snippet: Iranians say that sanctions have barred the country from updating its jetliners and left them to patch up planes that are too old to fly.
abstract: Iranians say American airline sanctions have barred the country from updating its fleet, forcing it to use substandard Russian planes and to patch up its older jets, leading to plane crashes that have left more than 1,700 passengers and crew members dead; Iran Air pilot Capt Houshang Shahbazi has started an independent campaign to persuade the Obama administration to lift the sanctions, signing up nearly 150,000 Iranians on his Web site.
lead_paragraph: Iranians say that sanctions have barred the country from updating its jetliners and left them to patch up planes that are too old to fly.

headline.main: Iran’s Aging Airliner Fleet Seen as Faltering Under U.S. Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Aging Airliner Fleet Seen as Faltering Under U.S. Sanctions
